lexUnit.name: retribution.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: punishment inflicted in the spirit of moral outrage or personal vengeance

sentence.text: ` Do I detect a desire for retribution against me , sweet Gina ? "

The second strong PR option would be to take the opposite line , to say how outrageous it is that there is all this terrible auditing going on , and to promise painful retribution for the wrongdoers .
Thomas 's superficial injuries could be seen as “ fair retribution for an adulterer cheating with someone else 's wife ” , he added .
The journalists ' satisfaction at retribution on a man who sneered at Britain in her finest hour now sounds like delusive and individual rant .
The government insisted this was the reason he secretly contacted Castro to mediate a solution that would save him from the drug dealers ' retribution .

If the first were correct , surely a house full of children and servants would have heard poor William 's pleas and , even if they had been too frightened of his mother 's retribution to release him , surely they would have passed him food .

Our farmers , seeking retribution or justice , and our consumers , who are equally seeking those concepts , now have to go to Brussels , for there is no way in which we may satisfy their aspirations .
And in the true spirit of Jacobean tragedy -- supplanted in this production by that of the Hollywood mafia gangster mode , he seeks retribution .
This action , compounded by John 's previous assistance in conveying silver from Cambridge University to the King , received savage retribution .
The retribution exacted by Constantius on the Britons is recorded by Ammianus .
Such acts of individual retribution , however brutal , were easily surpassed by the collective cruelty of the dictatorship 's official repressive machinery .

These losses , politically damaging , and bad for morale ( they were seen in Louis the Pious 's entourage as divine retribution on former rebels ) , weakened Lothar 's resistance to his father 's pressure .

It was then he knew for certain that the oriental he had just shot was not the one from whom he had wanted to exact retribution for injuring Pam -- because at the other end of the corridor he found himself looking into the glittering black eyes of his hated enemy , Angel One .
` One day , " said Jim calmly , ` I shall turn like the proverbial worm and take a terrible retribution upon you , Omally , for all the blows you have administered to my dear head . "
Nicephorus ' fleet harried the accessible southern coasts in retribution , but made no firm gains .
